meanings.definition: The process of making an area more like a suburb.
meanings.sent1: The suburbanizations of the city led to more green spaces and quiet neighborhoods.
meanings.sent2: The suburbanizations in the town attracted families looking for a peaceful environment.
meanings.sent3: The suburbanizations of the countryside made the cows wonder if they should start wearing suits and ties.
meanings.sent4: Her artistic touch turned the plain field into a masterpiece of suburbanizations.
meanings.sent5: The suburbanizations of the village painted a picture of tranquility and comfort.

meanings.definition: The act of turning an area into a suburb.
meanings.sent1: After the suburbanizations, the once bustling area became a quiet residential neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The suburbanizations of the outskirts transformed the landscape into a peaceful community.
meanings.sent3: The suburbanizations of the park made the trees feel like they needed to wear little picket fences around their trunks.
meanings.sent4: The suburbanizations of the old factory district brought new life to the abandoned buildings.
meanings.sent5: His vision for the suburbanizations turned the urban chaos into a suburban paradise.
